title: Wujuh al-Hajar
text: Wujuh al-Hajar (, also spelled Woojeh al-Hajjar) is a village in western <a href="Syria">Syria</a>, administratively part of the <a href="Homs%20Governorate">Homs Governorate</a>, southwest of <a href="Homs">Homs</a>. It is situated near the border with <a href="Lebanon">Lebanon</a> to the south, and nearby localities include <a href="Khirbet%20al-Ghazi">Khirbet al-Ghazi</a> to the northeast and <a href="Laftaya">Laftaya</a> to the northwest. According to the <a href="Central%20Bureau%20of%20Statistics%20%28Syria%29">Central Bureau of Statistics</a> (CBS), Wujuh al-Hajar had a population of 831 in the 2004 census.
